result.execSummary:
The defendant Keith Lashone Jones was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property fr. Person, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Restitution to be determined at hearing scheduled for May 18, 2016 at 01:30 p.m.

**06-07-2016 Judge Mark A. Sanders: Pay restitution in the amount of $439 to Andrew D.. Restitution to be paid during the term of probation (or if revoked, during the term of extended supervision). Restitution to be paid before costs, fees, assessments and surcharges. Any cash bail posted on this case to be applied to restitution owed. Costs, fees, assessments and surcharges to be paid after restitution. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Defendant is to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis (if not already done so).

Defendant to pay the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges during the term of Probation.
Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

If confinement is served, DOC to collect monetary sums/ amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds during the term of extended supervision.    Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Court advised defendant that he cannot possess firearms;
defendant cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.

NO CONTACT order with Andrew S. AND/OR   Cassandra S.
NO CONTACT  order with Potawatomi Casino.
Gambling Addiction assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.

AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY;  random screens.

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE -  84 months  with Zero (0) days credit; INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT -  42 months; EXTENDED SUPERVISION -  42 months.  
COURT STAYS the sentence and places the defendant on probation for a period of  4  years.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-  Serve 6 months in the House of Correction with release for treatment.  No electronic monitoring.  Condition time to commence no later than 5:00 p.m. on April 21, 2016.
